templates.description: Portainer Community Edition (CE) is a powerful, open source toolset that allows you to easily build and manage containers in Docker, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes and Azure ACI.
templates.post_up_info:
Visit https://{host-ip}:9443 to access the web interface.
Deafault username: admin
Default password: changeme
templates.note:
Visit https://{host-ip}:9443 to access the web interface.
  • Default username: admin
  • Default password: changeme
templates.name: Portainer
templates.title: Portainer

templates.description: The ChirpStack open-source LoRaWAN Network Server stack provides open-source components for LoRaWAN networks.
templates.post_up_info:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:8080 to access the web interface (might take a few seconds to boot). 
Default username: admin
Default password: admin
Check https://www.chirpstack.io/docs/ for for more details.
templates.note:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:8080 to access the web interface (might take a few seconds to boot).
  • Default username: admin
  • Default password: admin
    • Check ChirpStack documentation for more details.

env.label: CHIRPSTACK_GATEWAY_BRIDGE_HOSTS
env.name: CHIRPSTACK_GATEWAY_BRIDGE_HOSTS
env.description: Define hostnames, domain names and IPs for the gateway bridge servers (comma separated)

env.label: MQTT_BROKER_HOSTS
env.name: MQTT_BROKER_HOSTS
env.description: Define hostnames, domain names and IPs for the MQTT brokers (comma separated)

env.label: API_SECRET
env.name: API_SECRET
env.description: This should be some random unique string

env.label: NET_ID
env.name: NET_ID
env.description: NetID of your instance, if you have none stick to the default 000000 or 000001

templates.name: ChirpStack
templates.title: ChirpStack v4

templates.description: Node-RED is a flow-based development tool for visual programming.

Check https://nodered.org/docs/getting-started/docker for Node-RED docker quick start guide.

templates.description: The Things Stack LNS establishes a data connection between a LoRa Basicsâ„¢ Station gateway and a Network Server (in this case, The Things Stack).
templates.post_up_info:
Point your browser to the first local IP of the device or to the domain name (if you have defined one) using HTTPS to access the web interface.
Default username: admin
Default password: changeme
Check https://github.com/xoseperez/the-things-stack-docker for more details.
templates.note:
Point your browser to the first local IP of the device or to the domain name (if you have defined one) using HTTPS to access the web interface.
  • Default username: admin
  • Default password: changeme
    • Check The Things Stack LoRaWAN Network Server Github repository for more details.

env.label: TTS DOMAIN
env.name: TTS_DOMAIN
env.description: set this to the IP or domain name of the host you will be using to access the stack

templates.description: Grafana is a multi-platform open source analytics and interactive visualization web application.
templates.post_up_info:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:3000 to access the web interface.
Default username: admin
Default password: admin
Check https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/installation/docker/ for quick reference of running Grafana Docker image.
templates.note:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:3000 to access the web interface.
  • Default username: admin
  • Default password: admin
    • Check Run Grafana Docker image quick reference for more details.

env.label: Grafana plugins
env.name: GF_INSTALL_PLUGINS
env.description: Pass the plugins you want installed to Docker with the GF_INSTALL_PLUGINS environment variable as a comma-separated list.

templates.name: Grafana
templates.title: Grafana

templates.description: InfluxDB is a time series database built from the ground up to handle high write and query loads.
templates.post_up_info: Check https://hub.docker.com/_/influxdb for InfluxDB Dockerhub quick reference.
templates.note: Check InfluxDB Dockerhub quick reference for more details.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE
env.label: Influx initial mode
env.description: Set DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE to setup enables the InfluxDB image to automatically bootstrap the system.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_USERNAME
env.label: Influx initial username
env.description: The username to set for the system's initial super-user (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_PASSWORD
env.label: Influx initial password
env.description: The password to set for the system's inital super-user (Required,at least 8 characters).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ORG
env.label: Influx initial organization
env.description: The name to set for the system's initial organization (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_BUCKET
env.label: Influx initial bucket
env.description: The name to set for the system's initial bucket (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_RETENTION
env.label: Influx initial bucket retain data duration
env.description: Optional. E.g. 1w means tetain te data for 1 week. If not set, the initial bucket will retain data forever.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ADMIN_TOKEN
env.label: initial super-user's authentication token to associate with the system's
env.description: Optional. The authentication token to associate with the system's initial super-user. If not set, a token will be auto-generated by the system.

templates.name: InfluxDB
templates.title: InfluxDB

templates.description: Docker Registry is a stateless, highly scalable server side application that stores and lets you distribute Docker images.
templates.post_up_info:
Quick reference:
1. Pull(or build some image from the hub, e.g., ubuntu)
docker pull ubuntu
2. Tag the image so that it points to your registry
docker image tag ubuntu localhost:5000/myfirstimage
3. Push it
docker push localhost:5000/myfirstimage
4. Pull it back
 docker pull localhost:5000/myfirstimage
templates.note:
Check Docker Registry dockerhub overview page for more details.
Read the section regarding deployment to see more complex use cases.
templates.name: Registry
templates.title: Registry
